attributes.action: Make a legal temperature where it is too hot to attend work or school.
attributes.background: It is too hot for us to work effectively and efficiently this is damaging our health and education.
attributes.additional_details: This is a cause for medical concern as people are fainting and becoming dehydrated due to lack of air conditioning and shaded areas in certain work places and schools.

attributes.action: Base income tax on combined household income for a fair tax system
attributes.background: The current tax system places the highest tax burden by far on single-earner households and many single-earner families are sliding towards poverty due to the unfair tax system while single individuals without children enjoy some of the lowest tax rates of the western world
attributes.additional_details:
The current tax system is based on taxing individuals without taking into account how many additional people such as children depend on that income. It also severly punishes mothers who stay at home, despite research demonstrating that this is the best for young children.
The fairest way to support families is by taxing combined household income. This will also eliminate the unfairness of the High Income Child Benefit Charge threshold, where single-earner families loose the benefit with much lower income than double-earner families.
A tax system that is based on the combined household income is common sense and is the standard in most countries in the western world.
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/women/mother-tongue/8365211/Britain-worst-place-for-tax-burden-on-single-earner-families.html

attributes.action: Create a scheme that encourages those receiving state benefits to litter pick
attributes.background: As we know from recent media attention, litter is blighting our country and wildlife, and the only way to clear it up is to pick it up. The scheme would not only do this, but also give participants a sense of achievement and responsibility, perhaps encouraged by a reward.
attributes.additional_details: Further consideration should be made for the armed forces, whilst not engaged in military action, to contribute manpower to the scheme.

attributes.action: Ban pet shops from selling tortoises
attributes.background: Pet shops do not know how to provide the right care for these reptiles and keep them in the wrong conditions also some are too young to be sold and some are sold when they are ill and die later on.
attributes.additional_details: I bought a tortoise from the local pet shop it was way to young to be sold a little time later it died. I'm not happy with the conditions these poor animals are kept in and I would like it stopped. I would not like any other person or the poor reptiles to experience this.

attributes.action: Create a regulated market for Ecstasy
attributes.background: Ecstasy a.k.a MDMA or Midomafetamine is a common class A recreational drug deeply infused within British rave and party culture. It has been used as a party drug since the 60’s. Its been illegal since 1977 but this hasnt stopped the shear number of people taking the drug.
attributes.additional_details: This has resulted in a dangerous black market where many deaths have occured due to overdose or due to what has been mixed within the drug. This petition isnt trying to condone the use of the drug but to make a safe, regulated market where if the drug is to be used it is coming from a trustworthy and controlled source. This will ultimately reduce ODs, increase knowledge and education of the drug, create tax revenue, cut out the black market AND SAVE LIVES! Please do some of your own research:)

attributes.action: Formally request the EU allow UK citizens to request EU citizenship after Brexit
attributes.background:
It is clear that only 36% of the UK population voted for Brexit despite the more publicised voter turnout of 51.89% leave voters

The EU would agree that 64% of UK citizens (quite possibly more now) would like to remain or at the least retain EU citizenship as they oppose solo UK citizenship

attributes.action: Ban fruit and veg being wrapped/packaged in plastic by 2020
attributes.background: The UK government want to eliminate all avoidable plastic waste by 2042, so why not start where its easy. Most fruit and veg don't need packaging at all.  It will be a great place to start to help eliminate all plastic waste which is harmful to the environment and all life, including people.
attributes.additional_details:
Goverments environment plan: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/25-year-environment-plan 

Information about plastic pollution: www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/science-environment-42264788

attributes.action: NHS to provide badges for chronically/long term ill people for public transport
attributes.background: Currently NHS doesn’t provide people with chronic illnesses such as endometriosis and long term illnesses which have an impact on the persons quality of life badges for public transport. People with these conditions are extremely poorly would struggle to stand if there were no seats.

attributes.action: Guard those with health problems from malicious messages (epilepsy/ strobe GIFs)
attributes.background: People with health conditions have to take precaution in everyday life, however, if they are specifically targeted via social media or message then there is nothing place to protect them against this. We, the undersigned, call on the Houses of Parliament to review this and make necessary changes.
attributes.additional_details: On 5th February 2018, a person posted a Strobe GIF to an epilepsy group leaving several people ill and one in hospital. Her profile states that she is based in the UK. People in the UK have been to the police regarding this. The police have wanted to do something about this but current UK legislation does not cover this, it does not even fall under "malicious communication".

attributes.action: Make a crime that is motivated by prejudice against homelessness a hate crime.
attributes.background: Homeless people are some of the most vulnerable members of society, but face the risk of physical and verbal attacks by members of the public daily. Homeless people are at risk of having their possessions stolen and subjected to emotional abuse just because they live in absolute poverty.
attributes.additional_details: These are people who are discriminated against because they are affected by poverty. They should be protected by the same laws that protect people from other kinds of hate crimes.

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance to councils on the eligibility for a disabled travel pass
attributes.background: People applying for a disabled persons pass are being asked for evidence of having had a drivers licence refused on medical grounds, even when they have never applied for a licence. This has happened to many people including myself and others with epilepsy and it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
The Transport Act 2000 says you are eligible if you would be refused a driving licence due to physical fitness, IF you ever applied. The practice of demanding a refusal letter is therefore not correct, as the law does not say you have to have applied for a licence. 

Some authorities now accept a doctor’s letter, but a person has to get this by appointment with a specialist, which can cost up to £200. Clear and legally binding guidance must be issued to all local authorities so that they understand what the law actually says and stop denying disabled people what they are legally entitled to.

attributes.action: Clamp down on sexual harassment in clubs with nationally enforced regulations
attributes.background: Sexual harassment is an endemic issue faced by women on nights out in this country. It is disgraceful in 2018 that persistent unwanted attention and groping are just part of going out for women. Clubs and live music venues must appoint trained staff inside their premises to combat this issue
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is either existing staff are redistributed or new bouncers appointed to monitor the inside of the clubs. These bouncers would be easily visible so women can report any perpetuators without trouble and feel more safe and comfortable on nights out. Funding required in some cases could be provided by the government

attributes.action: Mental health services to become accessible  24/7 including help line funding
attributes.background: After suffering from mental health issues and also close family members I realised that unless you are in a mental health crisis between the hours of 9 - 4.30 Monday to Friday help is few and far between unless you contact 999. The government need to fund help lines with trained professionals.
attributes.additional_details: There are at least 10 different help lines out of these 10 there are only 2 open out of hours . One of these is only voluntary based not professional help and the other is professional led but is so over run with people needing there help they can't keep up . There are millions of people suffering ,the suicide rate is higher than ever with a vast majority of these happening " out of hours" ie weekends evening and nights more needs to be done to take this seriously so that this doesn't happen to another loved one

attributes.action: Make pas43 a minimum legal requirement for all breakdown and recovery personnel
attributes.background: After working with various company’s doing roadside breakdowns and recovery, some of which apply pas43. The dangers of this are horrifying. I think it’s about time these guidelines were made legal as a minimum requirement to get rid of the cowboys and to reduce further risk to everyone
attributes.additional_details:
Where some company’s will use pas43 and stick to the guidelines, give staff the required training. There are still company’s out there that will send untrained staff in any vehicle to broken down vehicles which are ill equipped and have no extra reflectors or beacon. 
I have also have an email from a parliament case worker stating pas43 is not a legal requirement and is down to the company health and safety to make sure that staff know what they are doing at the roadside. This needs to change!

attributes.action: Stop NHS sharing data with 3rd-party advertisers, analytics and social media
attributes.background: When you use NHS websites, you get tracked. The issue was raised in 2010 by MPs, but was not resolved. Instead, Facebook and other companies went on to get data for a further 7 years. NHS privacy policies say that there's tracking. Such 3rd parties should be barred from NHS websites and mobile apps.
attributes.additional_details: The combination of HTTP Referers, third party cookies and third party JavaScript, provide these parties with the ability to track users by their unique or user ids and identify pages visited. Furthermore, third party JavaScript allows them to change NHS page content as they see fit, access data on it or act as the user on pages. I've complained directly to the NHS, ICO and Ministers in the hope of getting this fixed, but it is still a serious problem.

attributes.action: Suspend the lease rental rule change from 130g/km emissions to 110g/km ASAP
attributes.background:
New lease rental restriction bands from April 2018 are negatively impacting company new car sales contributing to job losses across the UK.
Employees paying company car tax support’s the Treasury coffers by millions of pounds, but is in serious decline due too many alterations.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/lease-rental-restrictions/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/company-car-tax-to-change-over-to-new-wltp-emission-rules-from-april-2020/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/new-202021-company-car-tax-bands-favour-ultra-low-emission-vehicles/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/800000-drivers-face-70m-diesel-company-car-tax-hike/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/800000-drivers-face-70m-diesel-company-car-tax-hike/

attributes.action: Provide gym access to all who make national insurance contributions.
attributes.background: Our wonderful NHS is under constant pressure to provide care in our times of need. Targeting healthier living whilst we are able, our times of need may reduce. Some of the costs to becoming healthier should be eradicated and the emphasis placed on exercise becoming an expectation in adult life.
attributes.additional_details: I propose government funded gyms to all who make national insurance contributions. With funds contributed between employer, employee and government. Health is just as important as your pension, and an investment into personal health can only pay us all back. There are many reasons exercise benefits our physical and mental health.

attributes.action: Schools to teach anti crime and anti gang culture within schools.
attributes.background: With the constant rise in gang related death and crime it’s time to make a difference. Schools should teach anti crime and anti gang culture as early as junior school. We all need to work together to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
No parent wants to hear their child is the victim of crime bullying or hate, but worse still no one wants that knock at the door to say their child has died as a victim of it! 
Stop it before it starts we need to stamp out the whole gang culture that is rapidly growing within our schools and streets.
Children become involved due to peer pressure and it becomes a case of be a bully or be a victim! It has to stop.
Schools to clamp down and teach strict anti gang bullying and crime in schools.

attributes.action: Increase the age limit to 25 to buy alcohol.
attributes.background: On February 15th 2018 my little brother lost his life aged only 27 years old. He was an alcoholic and fought ferociously to overcome his addiction. I work in retail and I have to challenge anyone who appears to be under 25. So why not just make it legal to be 25 or older??

attributes.action: Brexit deal must contain a clause allowing us rejoin the EU on the same terms
attributes.background:
As a form of insurance against a potentially destructive Brexit we the undersigned petition the government to include a clause in any deal with the EU to allow us to rejoin on the exact same terms we are on now.

This will give us the ultimate get out clause if Brexit is as damaging as predicted.

attributes.action: Stop including student loans as “income” for benefits calculations
attributes.background:
We are calling upon the government to stop penalising those who are committed to making themselves more employable by studying for Higher Education qualifications.

A student loan must be paid back (with interest). It is not a grant - and therefore should not be considered as income.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently in the UK, those in receipt of a student loan have it included as “income” when benefits are calculated, and it can affect their entitlement.

Part-time students are particularly at risk; should they find themselves temporarily unable to work, they may not be eligible for the same financial assistance as another person in exactly the same position as them who is not in part-time study.

For more information on benefits that are affected by student loan: https://www.turn2us.org.uk/Benefit-guides/Student-Support/How-does-student-support-affect-benefits

attributes.action: Urgent Review & Increased Funding of "The 5 Year Forward View for Mental Health"
attributes.background: We urgently need more specialist psychiatric hospitals, walk in clinics, community psychiatrists and nurses.More Day Centres & facilities for people with mental health issues but to get the service back where it should be, we need the funding, and proper funding, to enable this to happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Approx. 15.5M people suffer with a mental health problem in the UK, which is roughly 1 in 4 people. Current plans need reviewing and funding needs injecting urgently. Awareness, Funding & Resources are quickly needed. Waiting times are excessive and lives are being lost as a result of this terrible dilemma we are in. 

Mental Health cases have have increased, which in turn has lead to an increase in our already stretched Emergency Services to deal with problems more frequently. LET'S TALK

attributes.action: Introduce laws to stop the sale of knives from easily viewable display cases.
attributes.background: With the increase of knife attacks across the UK. We are asking for tighter laws controlling the sale of knives from display cases. Knifes should be sold from covered cabinets. You can't buy cigarettes from open displays due to the impact on health. We should treat the sale of knives the same way.
attributes.additional_details: Open and easily viewable cases that display knives are showing them as glamour items. They show knives and advertise them as exciting accessible items. Take a store in Sheffield that is displaying knives like the USMC Ka-bar. This is clearly a military knife. If knives are not on display and are not easily viewed, accessible or advertised in a glamorous ways. People that use them genuine reasons will have to ask for them. This allows for retailers to question their legitimate use and purpose.

attributes.action: Recruit at least 20,000 more police officers.
attributes.background: There is a national crises. Volumes of emergencies have increased rapidly in the last 5 years. Speed is the key to solving crimes and there is the "golden hour" which is often missed causing loss of evidence resulting in not finding perpetrators.
attributes.additional_details: Figures obtained from the BBC Police under pressure programme on 16th May 2018. Police themselves are under threat from organised gangs who are aware of police limitations.  There have been 23,000 assaults on officers in 2014/15 alone. Not all assaults get reported. The rate of physical assault against police officers being almost 12 times the "all occupations" rate. Cracks are now beginning to show, increasing amounts of risk to public safety because there are less and less officers and staff.

attributes.action: Convert & retain The European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) into U.K. law
attributes.background: After Brexit, the European Convention, and the Human Rights Act which enshrines it in UK law, will be more important than ever. They will remain the most fundamental safeguard against abuses of human rights in the UK. This needs to be protected and converted to U.K. law before it’s too late!

attributes.action: Urge the UN to refer Southern Cameroons (SC) impasse to the ICJ.
attributes.background: There are serious human rights violations taking place in the Anglophone-speaking areas of Cameroon including killings, arrests, torture, disappearances, rape and the razing of whole villages after protests against assimilation. The SC impasse must be referred to the ICJ to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1961, instead of properly decolonising SC, Britain and the United Nations effectively annexed SC to RC. After unjustly ruling out full independence for SC, the self rule envisaged by UNGA Res 1608 (XV) of 21/04/61 in a federation of two states equal in status was never properly implemented. Today, our Anglo-Saxon educational, legal, economic and socio-cultural systems are under attack by RC assimilationists. 

We want the ICJ to rule in favour of a referendum for us to determine our future.

attributes.action: Make garden bonfires and any external fires illegal without a permit.
attributes.background: Bonfire smoke is a health risk for people with asthma & breathing problems. Wind will distribute smoke over a wide area, especially in steep sided valleys. It is a basic human right to have access to clean, breathable air. Environmentally safe waste disposal is universally available in the UK.

attributes.action: Permit all public universities to test cannabis for medical use
attributes.background: Cannabis is widely believed to have broad medical applications, and there is solid evidence to support some of these. We cannot know the true extent without research. It seems obvious that the current restriction is based on ideology rather than evidence, and this stance is academically unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis has been shown to improve the endurance of cancer patients and to improve the experiences of those with chronic pain.  Cannabis has also been shown to be minimally addictive and minimally harmful to health, whilst the debate over its social detriments has contained more heat than light.  The way to put this to bed, one way or the other, is to let the academics test it and find out exactly what it does.  We permit tests on other classes of drugs including opiates, why not cannabis?

attributes.action: Constitution to prevent ceding sovereignty to foreign powers without referendum
attributes.background:
In signing the European Communities Bill in 1972 thus taking us into the EEC without our consent, Edward Heath sacrificed our independence. Thus making the articles on the supremacy of British Parliament only of historical perspective.
He should've had referendum 1st on such constitutional change
attributes.additional_details:
In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change. 
We need a constitution that is not merely convention, but that is actually written into our law to prevent this happening again.

attributes.action: Fund research into carbohydrate polymers as an alternative to plastic
attributes.background: As you are aware, in the UK we create tonnes of plastic waste daily and this is becoming an increasing problem. We need to cut down on the plastic we are using. To overcome this, we can use carbohydrate polymers (cellophane) but the problem is there is not enough funding to support research into it.

attributes.action: Ban Concentrated Animal feeding Operations (CAFO) in the UK
attributes.background: CAFOs are common in the US, but are now beginning to appear in the UK. These huge industrial farms are inhumane and should not be allowed in this country. We believe they should be banned on animal welfare grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/may/29/revealed-industrial-scale-beef-farming-comes-to-the-uk

https://www.thebureauinvestigates.com/stories/2017-07-17/intensive-numbers-of-intensive-farming

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/the-controversial-mega-dairies-that-alarm-campaigners-and-divide-a-struggling-sector-of-british-a6744511.html%3famp

www.telegraph.co.uk/pets/news-features/does-uk-really-want-mega-farms/amp/

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Dog to be recognised as an Assistance Dog
attributes.background: I have mental health problems, anxiety and depression. My dog helps me get out; keeps me calm in town when it's crowded and stops me acting on suicidal thoughts. My dog has given me a reason to get out of bed. Surely this will also help the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: I have also spoken to other people with mental health and found their dogs have been a huge help to them.”

attributes.action: The right to register with two GPs for students studying away from home
attributes.background: Currently in the UK, you can only register to one GP (General Practitioner) at a time. People tend to register to the one nearest to their home address, but what if you're constantly going back and forth between two addresses? This is a problem students studying away from home have to face.
attributes.additional_details:
During each year of study, students receive 3 main holidays, this includes 3-4 weeks at Christmas and Easter and almost 3 months summer holiday. It is not uncommon to need health treatment during these periods, however, receiving the care needed can be a nightmare!

Not all GPs offer temporary registration, imagine the hassle of constantly having to re-register between two GPs. This also causes unnecessary inconvenience for GPs who constantly have to send patients files and data back and forth.

attributes.action: Make all ESA & PIP assessment centres fully accessible.
attributes.background: Too many people are arriving for a DWP disability assessment to discover they cannot get into the building due to steps, stairs or staff only lifts. Many of these people are being told they should have informed the assessment providers they required wheelchair access beforehand. This has to stop.

attributes.action: Make rail companies guarantee a guard or security person is on every train.
attributes.background: Merseyrail is to introduce new Driver-Only Operated trains. They only guarantee to have a second person on trains after 8 pm. Many antisocial and criminal incidents take place at other times of day. Trains should have a second person patrolling to maintain order, check tickets and help passengers.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014, Merseyrail spokeswoman Alice Owen said: “The safety of passengers is Merseyrail’s absolute priority,..." (reported in Liverpool Echo). This cannot be achieved without personnel on trains to ensure passenger safety.

If a passenger operates the alarm handle, there needs to be someone available to render assistance. The driver cannot do this. Without a second person on the train, the driver would have to go to the next station before stopping the train. This could make matters worse.

attributes.action: Ask Esther McVey to make a further statement to Parliament
attributes.background: Esther McVey's apology over her misrepresentation of the National Audit Office's report into Universal Credit does not stand up to scrutiny. She needs to further explain how she came to be using words that were the polar opposite to the report.

attributes.action: Allow the practice of euthanasia in the UK.
attributes.background: Euthanasia should be a human right for those who need and deserve the right to die. No human being deserves to suffer from an illness with no potential for recovery. It should be a choice for all critically unwell individuals if they wish to be euthanised.
attributes.additional_details:
In dire circumstances, it should be available for UK citizens to have the choice or their families to have the choice for an ill individual to die with dignity, to end suffering for the person of ill health. 
In the UK under ASPA (Animals : Scientific Procedures Act) 1986, there is a requirement to euthanise animals in order to prevent undue suffering. If this is legally viewed as a right and a requirement for mice, rats etc. why not for humans?

attributes.action: No to automatic opt in for organ donation
attributes.background: UK resident will be automatically opted in for organ donation and will have the choice to opt out after the Bill is passed.  This law should not be passed because it is our body and it is our human right to opt in ourselves if we want to.
attributes.additional_details: Our body is not the property of the government to give this consent on our behalf. It is a  violation of our human rights. People are aware of organ donation and can choose to opt in if they wish to opt in. People may not be able to opt out before their death as death can be sudden. People may not be aware of this law so it will be unethical to opt them in as they wouldn't know they have to opt out. We refuse this law should be passed where peoole are automatically registered to organ donation.

attributes.action: Increase highway maintenance funding to make the roads safe to use
attributes.background: Across the country, roads are in a dangerous state of disrepair. Many signs are dirty, broken or obscured by foliage. Road surfaces are badly potholed. It's likely that this neglect has contributed to deaths and injury. Clearly highway maintenance urgently requires a significant increase in funding.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to determine the will of the people for NHS and care funding.
attributes.background: Reports by respected institutions such as the IFS, OBR and Nuffield Trust indicate that NHS funding per person is budgeted to fall and that future spending needs to rise to meet patient demand. Despite this, the Government refuses to increase funding even to match that of other wealthy countries.
attributes.additional_details: To remove politics as far as possible, hold a UK referendum on whether to establish an independent Commission to decide how to fund both the NHS and social care or leave it to Governments to decide. Voters would be choosing between continuing as now or having an independent Commission to set strategic funding plans, based upon need and not ideology, for Governments follow.

attributes.action: Drop 4 of the 5 law changes that will affect UK motorists due later in 2018
attributes.background:
There are 5 motoring law changes that will affect the motorists of UK due to come into effect later in the year of 2018.

The new laws that this petition is against cover:
1. New driver restrictions, 2. Changes to VED for diesel cars, 3. MOT changes, 4. Leaner Drivers on motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see this article by DriveTribe for further information as linked below.

https://drivetribe.com/p/five-law-changes-that-will-affect-Utdk30x1QSOK_59b7U6Wfw?iid=Ifgt4G3vSGC2VK9QA6F34A&utm_campaign=idiotukdrivers&utm_medium=fb&utm_source=network

attributes.action: Make the Home Secretary explain to Parliament the lack of FGM prosecutions.
attributes.background: FGM has been illigal since the passing of the Prohibition of Female Circumcision Act 1985 yet there hasn't been a single conviction despite the estimated 103 thousand girls living with the consequences of FGM the UK. Such investigations are a police matter and they answer to the Home Secretary.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/female-genital-mutilation-fgm-case-per-hour-uk-nhs-circumcision-a7564571.html

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/jul/05/nhs-attended-to-9000-fgm-cases-in-england-last-year-report-reveals

http://www.bbc.com/news/health-40491311

attributes.action: Debate a national Long Service and Good Conduct medal for all NHS staff.
attributes.background: We do not recognise the contribution NHS staff make to our local communities and to the nation as a whole.  I feel medals should be awarded at 30 years and 50 years continuous unbroken service to all NHS staff who complete that amount of service.
attributes.additional_details: 30 year medal should be called the Long Service and Good conduct Medal and 50 years service should be called the Meritorious Service Medal.  Unbroken service should include Maternity leave, sick leave and bank staff and part time staff.  The medal should say " From a grateful nation" on it.  Ribbon colours and design should be put to NHS staff for their ideas.

attributes.action: Stop all animal testing in the UK
attributes.background: Animals are dying from animal testing and it isn’t fair on them as they have lives that they should be able to live

attributes.action: Require cars to be impounded or crushed for leaving dogs in hot cars.
attributes.background: Unfortunately we see so many dogs left in hot cars during peak summer periods due to owners whom haven't a clue. Although social media are widely broadcasting this they still leave dogs in cars. The fear of your pride and joy being crushed may just be the wake up call they need.

attributes.action: Make well-being and mental health an integrated part of PSHE from KS1 to KS4.
attributes.background: PSHE currently includes Sex Education along with skills to manage finances but does not seem to address the prevalent issue of mental health. The inclusion of well-being and mindfulness within these lessons are vital beginning to tackle this issue of poor mental health amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details:
PSHE on Gov.uk website.
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/personal-social-health-and-economic-education-pshe/personal-social-health-and-economic-pshe-education

Statistics on Mental Health 
https://www.theguardian.com/mental-health-research-matters/2017/jan/20/12-statistics-to-get-you-thinking-about-mental-health-in-young-people

https://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/statistics-and-facts-about-mental-health/how-common-are-mental-health-problems/#.WueVqujwbrc

attributes.action: Repeal the ‘Licensing Act 2003’ and restore the ‘Licensing Act 1921’
attributes.background: Binge drinking has become a huge cultural problem in the UK in our towns and cities. People’s selfish behaviour accounts for 12 - 15% of attendances at emergency departments due to acute alcohol intoxication. This peaks to about 70% on Friday, Saturday nights, Christmas Eve and New Years Eve.
attributes.additional_details: Return to older licensing laws where “on” and “off” premises sales of alcohol be restricted to 9 hours in the metropolis, 8 and a half hours elsewhere and 5 hours on sundays and bank holidays. The “Licensing Act 1921” requires a two hour interval and opening hours were 11am - 11pm in London and 11am - 10pm elsewhere. This will create a culture change and reverse some of the ill effects of the liberalisation of the licensing act in 1988.

attributes.action: Fund more services to Walsall by looking at reopening old lines and stations.
attributes.background: I am writing to please ask the government to look into reopening the old lines around Walsall like the Sutton Park Line, South Staffordshire Line, Walsall-Wolverhampton Line and to please add services to Wellington, Stafford, Shropshire, Wolverhampton (Direct) and to other places in England.

attributes.action: Ban Gambling Adverts Pre-Watershed
attributes.background:
This petition aims to get the government to introduce legislation to ban gambling adverts from being shown pre-watershed. 

Gambling is a huge problem in the UK, last year a Gambling Commission report finds more than 2 million people are addicted to gambling or at risk of developing a problem [1].
attributes.additional_details: [1] https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/aug/24/problem-gamblers-uk-gambling-commission-report

attributes.action: Ban the use of flammable cladding on all buildings
attributes.background: The Grenfell Tower disaster shows clearly that the use of flammable cladding should be banned on all buildings.
